headline: Syria's new army confronts the legacy of civil war
subhead: 'Syria after Assad' (4/4). The new volunteer army, structured by the country's transitional authorities, has struggled to integrate the various military factions that have emerged from the conflict during Bashar al-Assad's dictatorship.

subhead: The Parisian institution is bringing together exhibitions by the two French artists, who share a  favored material.

headline: The mysterious 'knocker' scaring elderly women in a Brittany town
subhead: For more than two years, a prowler has been knocking on doors and shutters during the night in a village in Brittany, France, creating a climate of fear among his preferred targets: elderly women. Authorities were slow to take the case seriously.

subhead: France's first lady made headlines with her comments about feminist activists who disrupted a performance of the comedian Ary Abittan. They were contesting the dropping of rape charges against him earlier this year. Le Monde reviewed the ruling and spoke to the plaintiff.

headline: Attacked by Trump, Europe wavers between denial and fear of reprisals
subhead: At risk of appearing weak once again, as they did after this summer's trade agreement, leaders of the European Union have opted to ignore the latest accusations from the US administration.

headline: Israel's reign of terror over the West Bank
subhead: Deadly shootings by the army, beatings by settlers, devastating raids, arbitrary arrests, torture in prison: The level of violence inflicted on Palestinians living in the territory has never been so high since the Israeli occupation began in 1967.
